overview: Crisis Loans can help with costs after an emergency or disaster - how much you can get, eligibility, and how to claim
title: Crisis Loans

table.body:
You can apply for a Crisis Loan to help with essential costs after an emergency or disaster, eg a flood or fire in your home. 

There is no set amount you can get - it will depend on your circumstances.

You don't need to be on benefits to apply for a Crisis Loan. 

Crisis Loans are interest-free - you’ll only repay the amount you borrowed. You’ll need to agree with a Jobcentre Plus adviser about how you’re going to [repay your Crisis Loan](/crisis-loans/further-information "repay your Crisis Loan").
table.title: Overview

table.body:
There is no set amount for a Crisis Loan. The amount you can borrow depends on:

* your personal circumstances
* any savings you have
* if you already owe any money to the Social Fund

^ A Crisis Loan doesn't count as income and will not affect other benefits you’re getting. ^

##What Crisis Loans can pay for

A Crisis Loan can help cover the following short term needs:

- daily living expenses 
- rent in advance 
- board/lodging charges 
- residential charges for a hostel 
- pre-paid meter fuel debt 
- travel expenses if you are stranded away from home 


##How Crisis Loans are paid##

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You can apply for a Crisis Loan if you:

* are 16 or over
* don't have enough money to meet your (or your family's) immediate needs after an emergency or disaster
* think there will be serious damage or risk to your (or your family's) health or safety without the loan

^ You might be able to get a [Community Care Grant](/community-care-grant "Community Care Grant") if you're not eligible for a Crisis Loan.^
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
If you're claiming for living expenses or urgent rent in advance then you should telephone Jobcentre Plus. For all other claims you can download a form and make a claim.

##Living expenses and urgent rent in advance

Contact Jobcentre Plus if you need a Crisis Loan to cover:

- living expenses
- urgent rent in advance

$C
**Jobcentre Plus**  
**Telephone:** 0800 032 7952  
**Textphone:** 0800 032 7958  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm  
$C

##Other applications for a Crisis Loan

If you need a Crisis Loan for any reason other than living expenses or urgent rent in advance, apply using an application form. 

Choose the form that applies to you - each one comes with notes to help you fill it in.


$D
[Download ‘Items and services in the event of a disaster - Form SF300’ (PDF, 264KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/docs/sf300-print.pdf "Download ‘Community Care Grant and Crisis Loan for items and services in the event of a disaster - Form SF300’ (PDF, 264KB)"){:rel="external"}

[Download ‘Day-to-day living expenses - Form SF401' (PDF, 157KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/docs/sf401-print.pdf "Download 'Crisis Loans - day-to-day living expenses - Form SF401' (PDF, 157KB)"){:rel="external"}

[Download 'Rent in advance - Form SF401R' (PDF, 169KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/docs/sf401r-print.pdf "Download 'Crisis Loans - rent in advance - Form SF401R' (PDF, 169KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

^ You can also contact [your nearest Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Find your local Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} to apply. ^
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
##Repaying a Crisis Loan

You’ll need to agree with a Jobcentre Plus adviser how you’re going to repay your Crisis Loan. They’ll help you make a repayment plan you can afford. 



^If you're on benefits, your Crisis Loan can be paid back by taking a small amount from your normal benefit payments. ^

###Disputes and appeals

If you're refused a Crisis Loan and you want to know more about the decision or you think it is wrong, [contact Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "contact Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} within 28 days of the decision.

You can:

- ask for an explanation 
- ask for a written statement of the reasons for the decision 
- ask Jobcentre Plus to look again at the decision to see if it can be changed

For more information [download 'If you think our decision is wrong leaflet GL24' (PDF, 500KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/docs/gl24dwp.pdf "'If you think our decision is wrong leaflet GL24' (PDF, 500KB)"){:rel="external"}

If you still think the decision is wrong, you can ask for a further review by a Social Fund Inspector. [Download ‘How to ask for an independent review’ (PDF, 78KB)](http://www.irs-review.org.uk/infocent/leafbook/irs1/irs1.pdf "Download the leaflet ‘How to ask for an independent review’ (PDF, 78KB)"){:rel="external"} for more information.
